clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Cognitive Functions in Bipolar Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Cognitive Functions in Bipolar Disorder Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Assessment of cognitive function in manic bipolar patient

detailed_description.textblock: Assessment of severity of mania and depression in bipolar patients then evaluate their cognitive function.

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of severity of mania in bbipolar patients
primary_outcome.description: EVALUATE manic patients by Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS)

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of severity of depression in bipoiar patients
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate depressed patients by Hamilton Rating Scale for depression(HRS).

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of cognitive function in bipoiar patients
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate cognition in included patients by Montreal Cognitive Assessment(MOCA) and P300.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between cognitive state in bipolar patient and(onset age,illness duration and number of episodes).

arm_group.description: diagnosed by DSM-5 and divided to manic,depressed and mixed last episod
not have any medical or psychatric problem affect cognition

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged 18-55 years
- Of both sex
- Diagnosed as bipolar by DSM-5(patient)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current medical and psychiatric comorbidities which may affect cognitive status.
- Substance abuse or dependence (except nicotine and caffeine)in last month.
- Somatic treatment with drugs known to affect cognitive status (cortisol, antihistamines, etc.)
